line_1: Who can observe the careful ant,
line_2: And not provide for future want?

line_1: That Phe's the wise industrious Ant.
line_2: Who reads my page will doubtless grant

line_1: And careless sing, and mock the lab'ring Ant;
line_2: (True Poets they) laugh at approaching Want,

line_1: And, O Thou Sluggard, tell me why the Ant
line_2: 'Midst Summer's Plenty thinks of Winter's Want:

line_1: But I have less Sense than a poor creeping Ant,
line_2: If I take not due Care for the Things I shall want,
